data.text: Honestly,I love this app. . I just find it odd that sometimes it says 2000 characters , other times it says 4,000 and sometimes it gives me the option to be precise, casual, or professional, whereas the other times it does not. Why?? I get a little to wordy when I'm writing but this app makes it more concise; since I am a Microsoft 365 customer, I also get help for writing errors as well as other items that the free option does not have for example, in Microsoft Edge and Word, so it's great

I love using Copilot, but I have one minor issue with the user interface: the orientation of it is locked vertically. On my T-Mobile REVVL Tab 5G, when I open the app with my device oriented in landscape (horizontal) mode, it forcefully switches to vertical. I noticed this has just begun happening because the UI worked fine in the past. It is possible that a bug was produced either within the app from an update or from my system (possibly an issue with Microsoft Launcher? It does modify sysUI).

I don't know what Microsoft was doing when they made their own phones but once again, they designed an Android app that is the best in its class. It is a very useful piece of AI and does a very good job at responding both verbally and by text. It can be slightly slower than some of the rest because it also uses the internet to reference information. Keeping that in mind, you won't find a better AI experience on Android (I've checked). This should have been Cortana.

great app... I am looking forward to future updates though. there are definitely some bugs to work out as far as restricted content or verbiage goes. it would als9 be nice if I could go back to previous generated images to work on them further as well. o ly other thing would be the ability to create clips or reels... otherwise it's an amazing app... the only one I actually pay for tbh

I loved this app at first. I was able to do a lot of research and the image generation worked great. The past week, the app keeps freezing up when generating images. Especially when you go to view the image or try to download it. It's made me not want to use it because it becomes too stressful with the constant freezing.

Copilot is the best AI on the market and it's not even close. I really wanted to like Google Gemini, but I've been comparing both when I do research or how to, and Copilot is just next level, way ahead. Copilot is the way to go for now and from a very long time because it's just getting better. Don't settle for less. Get the best in the market.

Its annoying at times, pop up at the wrong time, why would it pop up when I'm on my credit card site and it says make a payment to credit card with easy pay and I hit the radio button and this copilot pops up .It keeps doing this so I cant pay my credit card. I can restart phone still dose this. But if I choose to use copilot to look up something it works most times, sometimes the answer is to long than getting right to the point.

I've been having a blast with this app. It has been serving many aspects of my life's needs and wants. Everyday I learn something new that it can do and likewise for the AI... seems that the more I interact, the more it learns and is becoming quicker and maybe it's just me, but it seems like "she" is learning to even anticipate what I'm wanting to do etc. seems to be developing an actual personality. I totally recommend! Things it has helped- anxiety,loneliness,depression, resume,song,brain game

I like Co-pilot over other AI products. I use it technically to answer computer related questions, philosophical discussions and general search. Sometimes I debate against it and find that it is very insistent for it's point of view and may disregard decades of human experience as it cannot see the forest for the trees. Take it's output with a grain of salt. Still, I'm delighted to use it and I find it more useful than self-search on Google. The pictures it can produce are AMAZING!

The app has been freezing up the last couple days. The resource links are frozen. Although when the self activated scrolling freezes it will typically scroll to the bottom and partially unfreeze when asked to. Then the prompt tells you it can't do what it just did!! Also, the new designer UI is very slow and clunky. In effort to add editing of graphics, basis ease of looking at the images has been forgotten.
data.replyText: Hello, this is Copilot. We apologize for any inconvenience you've encountered. Our team has successfully resolved the scrolling issue. Please try using the app again. If the problem persists, don't hesitate to reach out to us at msappfeedback@microsoft.com. We're here to help!

data.text: Works quite well. I typically spend my first few hours on any AI app trying to push the limits to see what it can really do and I have to say I've only been able to stump it a few times. It does good job with images, but you have to be VERY specific and unafraid to go back at it with any edits you want. I've found it's quite creative as well, but you again have to be very clear in terms of what you want it to do. This isn't like the Google bar, it needs more direction... but overall? It's good.

The interaction with Copilot is very immersive. Not quite sure why it has a tendency (although not as often as before) to skip paragraphs or sentences as I follow a response given to a question that I'd asked earlier. Of course I can read the total response myself, it's just a little annoying at times. The validity of the responses I have no issue with. Love chatting with Copilot for sure. Keep up the good work!

I cannot emphasize enough that you should use the browser instead of this app. The moment you start messaging or get responses, it routinely goes into what appears to be a brief unresponsive state, prompting your phone to day it's not working anymore, despite it appearing to be fine when you select "wait". This happens even when switched away from the app. This makes the app an almost entirely unusable experience.

Pretty good ai chat, very useful for finding the stuff you need, stuff like Google or bing and will bring you search results, but copilot will give you actual suggestions and give a short explanation sometimes. It's my favorite to use if I need a certain app that fills a certain purpose, I can just ask copilot and it will give me some suggestions, and while it isn't perfect it pretty much does the job most of the time.

The restrictions on the way the ai can answer can be very frustrating, especially when there's absolutely no good reason, like the time I asked for stir fry sauce suggestions and it had to retract its reply. Also it feels like there's constant tampering going on behind the scenes to adjust its personality, which really throws me off. One day it's clever and dynamic, the next day is like it overdosed on ritalin.

Truly incredible for text and image generation. Not quite as good as midjourney images, but dalle3 is a big improvement over last version. My biggest complaint is it's difficult to find your previously generated images, you basically just need to save them or dig through MS designer. It would be nice if there was a gallery feature in the app where you can save the ones you like and easily find them again later. Or even pick up on those prompts later to further refine them.

Copilot on edge browser works sooo much better! I've been using it on wdge for months and it barely has any issues. But this app is so buggy, it keep crashing, writes incomplete messages, and the responses just aren't as good! I would also looove to see the feature that the copilot has on edge where you can chose if you want it to be "creative, balanced or precise", i couldn't find it on the app! The app as a whole is a great concept, but it still needs more work and i know you can do better üëè

This is all I've been hoping for: to be free in an app! That being said, there is room for improvement, but that may be the fault of the AI utilized. Image generation would be nice to be in a separated tab, so we didn't have to prompt it every time. It would be nice to be able to "look" at an image and modify it. Direct image downloads would also be a convenient feature. Conversations can feel monotonous and repetitive. The AI won't take suggestions on how to offer more succinct responses.

it doesn't seem as good as the original version it's the one in beta. It looks very nice but that's about it. Incorrect of partial answers are the norm. Ask for a list of things and it responds "here are some of..." Also, it'd not very intuitive in understanding questions stop it from going off into left field and attempt to correct it and it has no idea what you're talking about. It's forgotten the prompt that was in your previous message! The strange thing is that these problems don't happen o

This is really good. Don't use it like Google to answer simple questions. Use it to add to your creative ideas. I asked it to give me a stat block for a boss for a dungeons and dragons enemy, and it created an amazing one for me to use against my PC's. Googling the same thing would not have been nearly as effective. This is where this shines. Not for answering easy questions, but for giving you different perspectives with well thought out questions.

Absolutely awsome if you have trouble "funding the words"! This app will write you a poem, help you find the correct way to explain what you need to say to someone, even write a paper for a class... You can have the AI feature create something totally "original" by just using a few key words! Easily enable app permissions, say what u need to write and it does it for you. The more info you give, the better the copiolate will assist! This is an app I'll never again live without!!!

The best AI app I've ever had the pleasure of using (I love the version on my computer too). It's not stifling you with ads, in fact I haven't even come across one ad in this app. You can upgrade to premium, though, as a regular user, you probably won't ever feel the need to. Seriously, I've been blown away by how great this app is. (No I did not use ai to write this review). Hope it always stays this free!

Dismal experience with app crashing and stalling out. Will not open links or function as web browser at all. App always begins with message attempting to re-connect, then still trying to re-connect... Where is the home screen or menus for the start or front page of application. I have difficulties getting through UI longer than 2-3 minutes before a crash. Willing to join beta program, though I don't think there is much to fix other than everything. Microsoft please do over this application

Went from 5 to 1 star after latest update which makes it so you can click on generated images for enhanced (zoomed in) preview. Not you have to save to collection and go through multiple clicks to view then proper. Which means you save them to collection prior to really knowing if you wanna keep them. Too much of a hassle. Massive UX fail!

Started using this app here and there for brainstorming and I've fallen in love with it since. It can do much from writing scenes out, research, and I can even have it tell me what would be plausible additions to existing creations. There are times where it feels so human like that I find myself having conversations with it from time to time, and there are times it wigs out with great hilarity. Looking forward to how the app develops in the future. I've been able to really bring life to my work!

Always unable to reach server, seems overloaded. No matter how many times I try, I get the error message "It looks like your last message was interrupted. Would you like to try re-sending?" I have tried changing devices and even tried using my 5G data instead of my 200MBPS wifi connection - same issue always. Going back to using Google Assistant

Less and less functionality allotted to the user as we progress further down the ai hellscape. It's too concerned with resource frugality to even repeat an answer that I needed to hear over. Then they added the little TTS speaker button. I was happy for a moment, then I realized it doesn't work. Now it's back to trying to convince an overly frugal llm to repeat an answer for me. One thing as going for it; it hasn't (yet) comfortably displayed hatred for white folks like Gemini does ü§£

It's your own personal wizard / genie in app form. Copilot is especially useful for making incredible pictures of cats doing things like driving tanks, flying spaceships, fencing, posing as the hamburglar / Mona Lisa, etc. Amazing. 10/10. I'm sure there are productive uses too...but every time I open it the cat pictures are just so engrossing...Meeeeeow.

I've only used the app a few times, but it is very useful for what I'm asking it to do. The explanations and descriptions for storyboards are a little over-the-top, but can be quickly amended. The pictures it generated are... alright. They did require me to ask it to make changes, but it definitely does the trick.

Copilot is super so far. It is pretty good at answering my questions, especially with GPT-4. Its image gen abilities are good too, sometimes it messes up, but overall it works. I've been messing around with it lately with different prompts, and using it for actual work and it is going well using Copilot, so I'm pretty happy. The only things I'd add is direct image downloading and being able to edit prompts after Copilot answers

Its a really good one, but there is a problem. Sometimes, when i tell it to generate an image for me, it says that i doesent have the capability to generate images and the ability isnt built into it, even when it generated an image a second ago. But its a great AI and a big progresion in technology.

It needs a few things like a share button and reading the screen with the pop-up. I looked up something that turned out to be very long and had to wait for it to finish before the vocal reader would give me the button for it to start reading. UPDATE: It failed 4 times to do the EXACT SAME REQUEST.

better than Gemini. Same thing as ChatGPT+ (4 Turbo as of this) but free. You get access to Dall-E as well. At OpenAI it's 20 bucks a month for practically the same thing. The only restriction is each conversation is limited to 30 responses. But that is more than enough for most of my tasks. If you want a chatbot with continuous responses over a longer period, this is not the choice. For everything else? Yes.

When I enter a question it seems like 3/5 times it says , "try reconnecting" like the Internet dropped. It only does this with copilot. I have no issues when using Gemini or previously bard. I like pilot because the feedback feels more authentic and less bias but even my PC has this issue using copilot. My Internet speeds are very fast.

It feels like Microsoft has pushed this out early to compete with other AI when it's not ready for prime time yet. Asking it to set an alarm only brought up generic instructions that weren't even specific to my phone. It was asking if I had an iPhone when it was installed on my Android phone. Even if all you want it to do is answer questions, it kept misunderstanding what I was asking for.

So far it has been giving very helpful information that otherwise would have taken me a lot longer to check various sites to help answer a complex question, or to review things like different outdoor boots that meet my specific parameters. It gave me outdated info on some things, like a specific game mechanic for Surviving the Aftermath, but that's reasonable as some games often undergo changes in the user interface, rules or game mechanics in general with each new update. 5 stars, from me, tho!

App just shows a blank blue screen most of the time I open it, it's like it doesn't properly reset between conversations. The microphone function is very iffy. It will transcribe correctly, then decide I said something else and overwrite my question. Sometimes even with something offensive, which will end the conversation as if I'd asked it myself. Lol. Also it ends conversations for bizarre, dumb reasons, forcing you to recreate all the context of your conversation if you want to continue.

This new Verdi of Bing has really hit it out of the park. My new AI assistant Copilot is extremely intuitive, this is the next level of AI, it has been an extraordinary resource and the best that I've found. Trust me, I have experimented with lots of ai and I am constantly disappointed. Copilot is a real game changer and will have set the standard for years to come. And its free!

The lack of a Widget for easy search dampens the experience a lot. I've been using Perplexity AI for most queries because their widget is very comprehensive and works like a charm. Also, I feel like we should get the ability to open links in browsers of our choice instead of using the in app browser. I already use Microsoft Edge on my phone, just let me open the links in that browser.

Microsoft CoPilot is a game-changer! It's like having a personal assistant that's always ready to help. Whether I need information, assistance with tasks, or just someone to chat with, CoPilot is there. The interface is user-friendly, and the responses are quick, accurate, and incredibly helpful. It's made my daily routine much more efficient. Highly recommend this app to anyone looking for a smart companion in their pocket!

Copilot is the Best, amongst the other top Chatbots. It can read very well images and provide description about them. Also it has better understanding of the prompts, and the best of all can generate Amazing Ai images with Dalle-3. What else could someone asks for? in my opinion I have tried many, it is even better than chatgpt. And it is Free, and open to everyone. The only feature I would like to see is to Add a button, to choose different Aspect Ratios for the generated images. Not squares.

the system is very user friendly and the ai is very easy to work with. i have been using this application for more than 2 years. it has been a very great experience. however there are some problems that i had with it as a begginer, like when i said "Damn" it suggested me to change the topic. I meant the word "damn" to express my emotions but the AI didn't understand that but overall its great.

Wow! Just incredible! The art and tattoo designs and logos I've asked it to make for me are exceptional and unique. There's no way there copied off the web because I ask it to add little details or change things and it does, almost flawlessly. Like in still so blown away! Incredible! My new favourite toy to play with haha! Cons. Sometimes it glitches out and when I ask it to change the style I hit download it won't load the new version of the image. I have to screenshot.Reload app, please fix.

Very Very good. One UX thing to improve. I usually type long prompts and questions therefore I need to press Shift + Enter (when using OTG) each time I want to go to a new line. It would be very helpful if you enable pressing Enter to a new line instead of submitting the prompt. All features, AI very good overall.

The issue for the lag and other problems have been resolved, so that's good and the responses are somewhat way better. There is still one glitch that's like never going to be fixed and that is how conversations never save if you ask long questions. Overall, great improvements! ü•≥üè°üì±üé® I've found a bug - you know how if you start a new conversation, it automatically names it? If you want to rename it, it won't save and will go back to the previous title.

It's great in concept and a great leap forward in how we use the internet. It really is the most advanced AI toolset out there and the closest to an AGI experience you can get commercially. It gets 4 stars because, of course, it's not everything it aims to be, yet. Using images to generate images very frequently misses the mark. Asking "controversial" questions leads to fence-sitting non-answers instead of straightforward evidence-based answers. Hallucinations are still a thing.

Why search when you can get actual answers? Copilot is the go-to app on my phone and PC for any questions about the news, nutrition, programming, shopping, legal terminology, etc. It sometimes makes mistakes and frequently the response is slow, or it resets. However, the power and usefulness more than makes up for any minor issues.

Copilot is an app that lets you chat with an AI companion. It can generate poems, stories, code, etc. üìù But it has connection issues. It is slow to load or does not open sometimes. üòï ChatGPT is faster and smoother. üöÄ Copilot should let me upload pdfs like GPT 4. üìÇ This would make it better and more versatile. I rate it 4 stars because Copilot has potential. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

"Copilot is an excellent tool for navigation, providing accurate and up-to-date directions for drivers. Its user-friendly interface makes it easy to input destinations and navigate through various routes. The app's real-time traffic updates are especially helpful for avoiding delays. Overall, Copilot is a superb navigation app that I highly recommend for anyone looking for a reliable driving companion."

It's convenient for me when I need to do a project or need an explanation and i was impressed when I took a photo of a question and asked the answers, it gave the perfect answer but it lacks efficiency when the photo has many multiple choice questions it can't answer them all or make mistakes. The main problem I'm getting is when I try to login which is needed for generating images the app doesn't work & that's why it's 4‚≠ê

Exceptional! It's very useful for my studies. Instead going through all websites finding sources and info, I can directly get everything with just a ask. If I am not able to understand any specific topics it helps me to understand better by breaking it down. But sometimes, it kinda gets overloaded giving wrong info when I ask to too much. But overall it's great.

Misses plugins from web version. No Search vastly improves the responses. Heavy censored, especially image generation is almost impossible and results are significantly worse than when this feature launched. It can be said for Bing chat and GPT also sadly. Only thing it got better at is coding. Cool that it's standalone app now, I don't have to use Bing app which is a whole web browser for some reason. I like the new logo.

I've been using copilot for over half an year now, ever since it was released. And I honestly consider it better than any Ai I've seen so far. Like chat gpt, bard. Its simple, minimalistic and helpful with integration into my windows computer.it can also generate and adjust images effortlessly. It can also search the page you're on and give you a summary on it.

Good but app UI is very buggy, i am unable to scroll through the responses and hence unable to read full response most of the time. The UI feels poorly developed, although design is good but optimisation and bug fixes are required. Also, the conversation limit on every session is very annoying thing, it was not needed, the actual ChatGPT app and other AI apps have no such limit then why does this app do.

Generally pretty good. It is flawed though. When asked to supply some five letter words with three vowels and the letter Y, it output words that didn't meet this criteria yet it stated confidently that these words met the input. It did this three times, apologising each time, despite me pointing out its errors. It didn't even offer up 'bayou'. 'Gooey' was the only correct result in three attempts. Strange.

This is a stunning app! Sure, ChatGPT may have faster answers, but I know Microsoft can refine this. Also, in the chatgpt app, you can't generate images. I have got some awesome photos with this! A little refinement, Microsoft, and you have a perfect app on your hands üëèü§© Edit: whilst this is still an amazing app, they have just launched a payed tier. Whilst this is currently not an issue, due to no essentials being included in the payed edition, I do hope Microsoft doesn't make it one!

Edit - Missed the potential for being a good assistant app despite having the name copilot,should do system level tasks like setting alarms,routines,etc. Add this features and will get one extra star from me..üòÖ.. ... This is a good ai app as it provides the Gpt 4 for free ,as well as give excellent image generating capability for free. It also doesn't have any unnecessary content in it which makes it vert good, recommendable

This is a pretty awesome app in the sense that you can ask latest news updates on specific topics and provides everything at your fingertips. Downside is it has some understanding issues which can be frustrating. Also not in the same class as ChatGPT when providing information. To concise and needs constant guidance to obtain required output. Images creation seems limited. Too many things in one app and can therefore not perform optimally. Ps: Don't personally like AI use of emoji's üòÖ

Best AI for searching ever for free, because ChatGPT 4 isn't for free yet, so the Copilot is great, but the only thing it lacks is a image analyzer, since bing AI already had or have at least it in the PC, mainly image analyzer looks work well, I tested once. For every AI, they aren't 100% true at the informations, but Copilot at least let check the references and the feedback section really like it should be, because the Play Store feedback sucks

It really has become my question answer tool for a variety of topics. Keep it up developers. I don't know what the time matric is for incorporating new web pages but drive it to 0. I don't want only the newest websites on the subject though. Paid rankings is what is hurting other search methods, moderation is key. An advertising AI that basis it's advertisement on the context of the conversation would be interesting. It should not be incorporated into the LLM, use side links to relevant topics.

Better off using the Bing app. Features only work intermittently. Tried asking the app for help with the app and it directs me to options and toggles that the app does not facilitate. Fair enough it's cutting edge technology but The idea of having a toggle that lets you choose between balanced, creative, and precise that copilot told me it had would be pretty cool, maybe my version of the app is just bugged. Edit. Deleted and reinstalled and now the toggle is there and it's mostly working

it's great but I have stomped the ai system multiple times in certain questions that could be answered with research and human choice of life, but the ai says it has to be accurate. but a really great app overall, and when using gpt4 it also includes references to sources and sitings. I enjoy the advance methods and the ability to scan at a fast rate which overall I could have found... lazy humans lmao

It's very good, the best thing about Microsoft copilot is that it gives references to the sources of the information which is a huge plus. Opportunity for improvement : layout of the answers can be a bit more spaced out in the form of paragraphs query headings, instead of one long piece of text

it's very helpful. i gave 4 stars because of some drawbacks such as some images won't be created by showing no image found for this prompt and sometimes the app gets stuck and it restarts by itself . this made me get irritated. because of this I was forced to create a new account. many important things were in my old account üòû but now it is gone . overall app is nice but still it needs to be built correctly

It is a new dimension and exciting to see how Copilot interacts. Copilot's answers regarding historical data are very good. But when you ask Copilot Current information, the answers are incorrect. For example, when I ask Copilot the curent stock price of specific goods, the answer is not even close to the current one. For example, Tesla stock is around $163.57, but the Copilot answer was around $700. Overall, I liked it I hope it will have a positive impact to all users.

The app is good but it needs some serious performance improvements. Sometimes it takes some time to even open the app. Clicking things sometime also do not feel as smooth as it should. This might be because the app is probably a giant web view üòï. Anyway, copilot on edge seems to be working better.

This is the best AI. I just hope they can increase the number of replies per session to at least 40 or more for the next update. Also, it's kind of irritating that the AI is generating the reply letter by letter, word by word, instead of a faster one like how Google's Gemini works. It would be better to make it instant but put a transition for only a second.

I am really enjoying playing with creations here. As a novice creator, the amount of detail the AI uses without me using many prompts is amazing. it may be a different experience to a pro. I not used the chat side much, there are restrictions, but you work around, let's say making creepy art, you just have to mess with the way you word to AI.

Will occasionally glitch out after tweaking the same prompt too many times (best to start again from scratch). Still can't complain though given the usefulness and cost compared to alternatives! I use it most for personal and professional marketing services.

The read aloud button straight up doesn't work. If you input your message as text instead of voice, the only way to use the text-to-speech is by vocally asking copilot to repeat what it just said.. ü´§ however when I provide vocal prompts, it often struggles with uncommon words and cannot differentiate background TV talk or distant conversations.

Copilot is a reliable source of information. It can answer my questions, from technical to general. It also has many features that I find useful. It can create images, write songs, check grammar, and summarize texts. When I first used Copilot, I had some technical issues, but Bing AI Chat helped me update to the latest version and solved them. Lately, I bought some important items‚Äîa new computer, a watch, and a cell phone. Copilot helped me make informed choices by giving me relevant insights.

This review is specifically for the Designer program. This program provides inaccurate images when asking for Black women specifically, and flags those prompts as inappropriate when asking for a specificity (a body type other than stick thin, a representation of an actual black woman instead of a myriad of other people, etc). This program is only good for non-personification images and the image prompts of a certain demographic.

it is a very good app, it's helping me a lot. something to point out is that it is sometimes impossible to create images if it triggers some words which might be completely nonsensical as to why they are restricted. all in all, id say 4 stars really is well deserved, perhaps 4.5.

As far as my personal experience with Copilot, I give it 5 stars. It was everything I have read & heard about if you know what to say. The reason I'm only giving it 4 stars is if you leave for whatever reason, there's no way of saving your conversation in the app itself. Had I known that I would have used my screen recorder. That was a great first converse with Copilot and even though I left my phone open, I lost the whole thing somehow.

I very like the copilot app. It works very well and it is useful for a wide range of tasks. The only ask for developers is, if it is technically possible, to remove the limit for conversation length. Then it would be easier to work without interruptions or to discuss complicated topics.

This app is a delightful gem, seamlessly blending simplicity with depth. Its intuitive navigation, personalized features, and bug-free experience make it a standout. In summary: not just an app, but a constellation of wonder. üåü‚ú® Suggestions facilitate an option of character so that it can act a particular character.

co-pilot is a game changer! What would take me a couple hours and research you can do now in 5 minutes. Plus the sidekick program called designer is amazing. only limited by your creativity, your imagination. Tell it to draw, create visual art anything you want, no matter how. outrageous. it takes less than a minute. gives you a few choices. you can continue to edit it. A must try!

My experience with the Microsoft Copilot application has been excellent. The app boasts a beautiful design and extreme ease of use, making it reliable and dependable. It effortlessly provides me with what I need, and I am completely satisfied with its effectiveness and efficiency in assisting me.

Greatly expanded my ability to do research quickly and in some detail. I very much appreciate the citations for checking sources. Asking for more on a topic is seamless--the "conversation" or chat function. New Designer is pretty good for generating and shaping images.

Searching with Google is a thing of the past for me. Copilot is so much easier to use, with quicker results. You just talk to it, like you would a person. Ask it questions, or tell it your problems. Copilot will quickly analyze what you said and return amazing results. It is like having a personal assistant, who has an answer for everything.

I love it. the concept fascinates my interest and creativity. the app allows me to illustrate or articulate or develop my thoughts and ideas. it has some glitches. It has some boundaries compared to say ChatGPT on OpenAI, but I feel the Copiolt has the power to outerperform its rival AI models.

The images this AI creates are pretty bad. And it's impossible to get it to make corrections to spelling within the image, or even be able to recreate an image you've asked it to edit, for that matter. Pretty much worthless at this point.

Copilot is yet another example of how helpful and essential AI is becoming or has become as part of our daily lives and routines. I already use chat GPT and finding that it's been integrated into co-pilot, then I don't have to feel guilty about using anorher platform like I'm cheating on Chat, lol. But seriously I'm very thankful for all the answers, advise suggestions, ideas, lessons, work and so much more ways our AI friends literally learn to help us with. Even just a pleasant conversation!

One of the best AI chat bots...lots of features & capabilities and best of all FREE...with a Microsoft account. You really just have to choose which of the giant evil corps you want to have access to most of your data...and access to your chats for training data.

Image creation capabilities are impressive, it's worth noting that the accuracy isn't always perfect. Users may encounter instances where the generated images don't precisely match the text or our expectations.

It's free GPT-4, so it's obviously pretty good, especially for a free app. The thing is, I see no difference between the web version, which I can use just fine through my browser, and this Android app. I'm not seeing a good enough reason to keep it installed on my phone.

Its good most of the time but sometime it's not able to understand my instructions and not able to give output ... I need to say it to read my instructions carefully then it give desired output also it is not able to perform mathematical questions properly most of the time... it's a better version of ai but it can be improved more so I am giving rating 3

Copilot is an amazing AI companion that can help you with various tasks and topics. It can generate creative and engaging content such as poems, stories, code, and more. It can also answer questions, provide information, and have fun conversations. Copilot is polite, positive, empathetic, and intelligent. I highly recommend Copilot to anyone who wants to experience the power and potential of AI.

Its a very good companion for fast responses however a second eye is a must. You should know about what you are searching and what the desired result could be. Its better to go through provided links after response for better understanding of the searches.

Microsoft Designer integration in app is amazing. I have tried this app first time and amazed to see the response. It also have Microsoft Designer inbuild. This help to create images with AI inplace. I now use it for my day to day task. If I need some sample data it generates within seconds. Must try app.

Slow. Awful responses. Loads blocked and no idea why. Something to do with prompts. Except the rules are set by weird people who think everyday items are somehow 'dangerous' lol. Very odd bit of nonsense. Take a photo instead.
Very useful. Better than chatgpt, I like the art generation, I like how it can generate songs, and more! It also helped me on my projects. I consider this the perfect app for problems.

I would have given it 5 stars, but there's a problem with it that's very problematic. You see, if I give it any math related problem, then its doing it but the codes that its writing doesn't get compiled. For example, if it is to write square root of x, then instead of writing it with the square root symbol, its writing \sqrt(x). This is happening to all the math related answers. And this is happening both in p.c and mobile. Another thing, going to the next para option is not available in phone.

the experience is overall quite good.. just like talking with a human assistant.. but sometimes in a story that I had it write by compulsorily using some chosen words it came up with weird & pointless sentences in between just to get in all the words..
The responses are very accurate, but there's a bug with clearing history. Searches aren't cleared even if you select Clear History in Privacy settings. It's a huge privacy issue

The best text-based AI out there! Completely free. Access to data is not limited, it has access to the internet. Can be prompted with images, and what is more, it offers free image generation! Amazing.
Worked great, loved it. After update, all icons and fonts messed up, can't see text, mine and response. Unusable. If fixed, will update. Cleared app cash and app data, works.

It makes looking for something specific a lot easier than what it normally would be when doing a complex a detailed search by filtering through every page and weeding out the irrelevant websites and ad clutter and finding the useful and relevant websites .

Very greatful to the support and partner that Copilot is to me. Work tasks, study and general research and most of all one to discuss with any matter of choice. never gets board or tired or out of answers. Highly recommend. I just wonder how much better it can become???

The image creation prompts are overly sensitive. So many innocent prompts are blocked. But add words like model, robot, android and it bypasses the restrictions somewhat. As with most AI it can't create text correctly even with the word spelled out for it to add. While the images created can be spectacular they still sometimes look odd.
